hints.content:
Area is the number of square units that cover a shape.

We need to find a rectangle with the same area.

Let's imagine that we finish drawing the unit squares in the rectangle.

- How many rows of unit squares would there be? 

- How many unit squares would be in each row?

[[☃ image 1]]

The rectangle has $\blueE{8}$ rows with $\maroonD{10}$ unit squares per row.

options.alt: A rectangle covered by a grid of unit squares with 8 rows and 10 columns. A curved bracket across the bottom of the rectangle is labeled 10 and a curved bracket to the right side of the rectangle is labeled 8. !

hints.content:
We would use the same number of unit squares to cover this rectangle, so it would have the same area:

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A rectangle with the right side labeled 8 units and the bottom side labeled 10 units. !

question.content:
The following rectangle is partially covered with unit squares.

[[☃ image 1]]

**Which figure has the same area as the rectangle above?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A rectangle divided by a partially complete grid of unit squares with 8 rows and 10 columns. Part of the rectangle is divided into 8 equal-sized squares. The remainder of the rectangle shows partially drawn rows and columns. !

choices.content: ![A rectangle with the right side labeled 10 units and the bottom side labeled 10 units.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b8dba6835362ca147e638f79b0f7066745b66b54)
![A rectangle with the right side labeled 8 units and the bottom side labeled 10 units.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/5908730414df97b8ef53b53434bbc5d403ed3e13)
![A rectangle with the right side labeled 6 units and the bottom side labeled 10 units.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c3cb3d0ad04bff322d5e5a1454efaa889b2de29a)
![A rectangle with the right side labeled 4 units and the bottom side labeled 10 units.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/683e0c1a0b0101281ef6baff70b89a5e7160c9cb)
